definition: to fight back/to return fire/to counterattack
to circle/to go back/to turn around/to answer/to return/to revolve/Hui ethnic group (Chinese Muslims)/time/classifier for acts of a play/section or chapter (of a classic book)

sentences.english: Enough is enough they say - it's time to fight back.
sentences.chinese: 他们认为恶作剧的时间已经够了，现在是时候回击了。

sentences.english: A composite formula for calculation of horizontal electric field generated by return stroke current is presented.
sentences.chinese: 提出了一种计算地闪回击电流水平电场的混合法。

sentences.english: After we fired back, there was no further response from the DRPK.
sentences.chinese: 我方回击后，朝方没有进一步回应。

sentences.english: We replied to the enemy's attack with a barrage.
sentences.chinese: 我军以齐射的炮火回击敌军的进攻。

sentences.english: The player should learn to use a cross over step to recover from wide balls.
sentences.chinese: 选手应学习在回击大外角球来球后，以交叉跨步回防。

sentences.english: To which there seemed no more effectual reply than to go on killing royalists.
sentences.chinese: 除了继续杀害保王党人，似乎没有别的更有效的回击。

sentences.english: The Mon Calamari and the Quarren joined together to fight back against the invaders.
sentences.chinese: 蒙卡拉马里人与夸润人联手回击了入侵者。

sentences.english: The Americans returned fire with heavy machine guns and grenade launchers.
sentences.chinese: 美国人用重机枪和榴弹发射器回击。

sentences.english: Johnson returns it crosscourt , deep to the right baseline comer.
sentences.chinese: 约翰逊打出斜线球回击，球打到了底线右角。

sentences.english: The Club World Cup champions cannot possibly reply to the newly-promoted Juventus.
sentences.chinese: 世俱杯冠军也许无法回击升班马尤文图斯。

sentences.english: He was out trying to turn a ball to leg.
sentences.chinese: 他想把球回击到击球员左后方场地，结果出局了。

sentences.english: This is a good chance to strike back your political opponent.
sentences.chinese: 这正是回击你的政敌的好机会。

sentences.english: Srk's reply to critics that say he has only 5 expressions that he keeps repeating.
sentences.chinese: 沙沙回击评论家批评他一直在重复五种表达方式。

sentences.english: The Gaddafi fighters hitting back with heavy weapons.
sentences.chinese: 卡扎菲的士兵用重武器回击。

sentences.english: What made it different is that officials fought back hard for the first time.
sentences.chinese: 与以往不同的是，这次官员首次进行了有力的回击。

sentences.english: Now and then the Nietzsches of the world have fought back.
sentences.chinese: 不时地，世界上这些尼采的追随者正在回击。

definition: to strike back/to beat back/to counterattack
to criticize/to find fault with/to denounce
to retaliate verbally/to hit back (at critics)
to bombard/to bomb/(fig.) to criticize/to roast
to bombard/to bomb/trad. also written 炮轟
to attack/to accuse/to charge/an attack (terrorist or military)
to gain the initiative by striking first (idiom); to preempt/to anticipate/preemptive
